decks.notes: The main idea behind this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. By using Geist of Saint Traft as the commander, the deck aims to protect and support the commander while disrupting the opponent's strategy. The deck includes various powerful cards like True-Name Nemesis, Stoneforge Mystic, Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Elspeth, Knight-Errant to maintain board presence and provide card advantage. The deck also includes a wide range of counterspells and removal spells to deal with threats efficiently. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by generating incremental advantages and maintaining control of the game until victory is achieved.

This deck focuses on using the commander, Xenagos, God of Revels, to ramp up mana quickly and play powerful, hasty creatures that can deal massive damage to the opponent. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and finish the game as quickly as possible. The deck includes a variety of mana dorks to accelerate mana production, as well as creatures with strong abilities or high power/toughness ratios. Additionally, there are cards included for additional creature tutoring and ramping, as well as protection against removal spells. The strategy is to quickly set up a board presence and use Xenagos' ability to double the power of creatures, allowing for swift victories through combat damage.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of board wipes, removal spells, counterspells, and powerful planeswalkers. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a dominant position on the battlefield. The commander, Merieke Ri Berit, provides versatile removal options while also enabling synergies with the deck's creature base. The deck's mana base is carefully crafted to support its three-color identity, ensuring consistent access to the necessary colors of mana. Card advantage is also prioritized through draw spells and powerful card selection effects. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent, ultimately securing victory through superior resource management and control of the game state.

This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of powerful counterspells, removal spells, and card draw options to control the game and prevent opponents from executing their game plan. Narset, Enlightened Master serves as the commander and provides additional value by allowing the player to cast spells for free off the top of their library. The deck aims to control the board with counterspells like Force of Will and Mana Leak, remove threats with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Council's Judgment, and generate card advantage with spells like Dig Through Time and Fact or Fiction. By disrupting opponents and maintaining control of the game, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents to secure victory.

This deck focuses on building a board presence quickly and efficiently while disrupting the opponent's strategy through hand disruption and removal spells. The key strategy is to play aggressive creatures early on, such as Arbor Elf, Avacyn's Pilgrim, and Birds of Paradise, while using disruptive spells like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Hymn to Tourach to control the opponent's hand. The deck also includes powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, Maelstrom Pulse, and Castigate to deal with threats on the board. By combining a strong aggressive game plan with disruptive elements, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory in the 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through hand disruption and removal spells while ramping up mana with lands like Cabal Coffers and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan by using cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Mind Sludge to disrupt their hand and board state. With powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, along with removal spells like Damnation and Toxic Deluge, the deck can handle various threats on the battlefield. The ultimate goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of control elements and powerful finishers like Griselbrand and Karn Liberated.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble a powerful combo using the graveyard recursion ability of Karador, Ghost Chieftain. By utilizing cards such as Survival of the Fittest, Birthing Pod, and Fauna Shaman, the deck can efficiently tutor and find combo pieces. The deck also includes a variety of sacrifice outlets like Carrion Feeder and Viscera Seer to enable combos with creatures like Fiend Hunter and Karmic Guide. Additionally, disruption elements like Thrun, the Last Troll and Sin Collector provide protection and disruption against opponents. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure smooth and consistent mana production to support the combo strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Burgeoning, Mox Diamond, and Exploration, allowing for explosive plays and early drops like Titania, Protector of Argoth. The deck also focuses on land destruction with cards like Wasteland and Dust Bowl, disrupting the opponent's mana base while benefiting from Titania's ability to create Elemental tokens from lands entering the graveyard. The deck includes powerful ramp cards like Primeval Titan and Sylvan Primordial to further accelerate its strategy, as well as cards like Reclamation Sage and Acidic Slime to deal with threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive land plays and powerful creatures.
